0: Satellite radio company SiriusXM to buy Pandora for $3.5 billion 11:12 AM ET Mon, 24 Sept 2018 | 01:00 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Satellite radio company SiriusXM plans to acquire music streaming service Pandora in a $3.5 billion all-stock deal unveiled Monday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The agreement includes a "go-shop" provision where Pandora "may actively solicit, receive, evaluate and potentially enter negotiations with parties that offer alternative proposals following the execution date of the definitive agreement." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Acquiring Pandora would make SiriusXM the world's largest audio entertainment company, with over $7 billion in combined revenue expected in 2018. The deal would bring together SiriusXM's 36 million subscribers in North America and Pandora's more than 70 million monthly active users. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Pandora shares closed trading down 1.2 percent at $8.98 a share, after rising more than 10 percent in premarket trading, while Sirius stock fell 10.3 percent to $6.26 a share. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Shareholders will receive 1.44 of newly issued SiriusXM shares for each Pandora share they hold, the companies said.
